title: [Large-Scale] University Science Job Application Course Based on Extreme Apprenticeship: Optimizing Experimental Design and Data Analysis

context.prior_knowledge: Knowledge of college-level foundational sciences (physics, chemistry) and basic mathematics (calculus, linear algebra), practical application experience, and understanding of scientific inquiry methods
context.additional_context: Strengthens scientific modeling competencies for in-service practitioners to solve workplace problems, providing real-time feedback in VR simulation environments. Integrates experimental design and data analysis processes, emphasizing problem-solving capabilities based on scientific methodologies.

learning_goals: Learners independently design science models based on real-world scenarios three or more times, clearly defining variable control and experimental procedures.
Learners evaluate the validity of scientific solutions in VR simulation environments with ≥80% accuracy, utilizing measurement data and evidence-based analysis.
Learners provide two or more improvement suggestions for peers’ science models using peer feedback, offering feedback grounded in hypothesis verification and analytical methodologies.
difficulty: Easy - Simple structure with minimal constraints
